dsDescriptionValue.value: The Behavior Change Intervention Survey (BCIS)/Output Tracking Survey (OTS) was conducted in multiple rounds between April, 2006 to November, 2008 in four states (Maharashtra, Karnataka, Tamil Nadu, Andhra Pradesh) of India. The PSI/Avahan intervention was an integrated behaviour change communication programme that used multiple media channels (interpersonal communication (IPC), outdoor static promotional materials and mid-media activities) in 100 hotspots (venues where FSWs are solicited) in the four states. As part of the Avahan India AIDS Initiative, a behaviour change communication programme sought to increase consistent condom use (CCU) among male clients of female sex workers (FSWs) in four Indian states through the use of outdoor static promotional materials, interpersonal communication and mid-media activities.

keywordValue.value: Behavioral tracking surveys with clients, Clients of FSWs, Communication, Condom use, HIV prevention, Key clinics, Sexual behavior, Social marketing; INSTITUTION: PSI;  STRATEGIC AREA: Clients of FSWs

publicationCitation.value: Lipovsek V, Mukharjee A, Navin D, Marjara P, Sharma A, Roy KP. Increases in self-reported consistent condom use among male clients of female sex workers following exposure to an integrated behavior change program in four states in southern India. Sex Transm Inf 2010; 86: i25- i32.

Lipovsek V, Mukharjee A, Navin D, Marjara P, Sharma A, Roy KP. Increases in self-reported consistent condom use among male clients of female sex workers following exposure to an integrated behavior change program in four states in southern India. Sex Transm Inf 2010; 86: i25- i32.

Roy KP, Mahapatra B, Bhanot A, Kapoor A, Ward D, Narayanan SS. Psychosocial Correlates of HIV-related Sexual Risk Factors among Male Clients in Southern India. International Journal of Psychology and Behavioral Sciences 2012; 2.

otherGeographicCoverage.value: Maharashtra, Karnataka, Tamil Nadu, Andhra Pradesh

fields.value: Stratified two-stage cluster sample surveys were conducted among clients of FSWs in selected clusters in four Avahan targeted states. Cross-sectional surveys of clients of sex workers were conducted at hotspots across the four states in May 2007 (n=1741). The sampling frame for the May 2007 survey was based on an existing list of hotspots compiled by PSI; it was updated on an annual basis. Stratified two-stage cluster sampling surveys were conducted with hotspots defined as the primary sampling units (PSUs). States were regarded as strata, although Maharashtra was divided into two strata: Mumbai (due to its size) and the rest of the state. Baseline (April 2006) and endline (November 2008) surveys were conducted for programme evaluation purposes, while the three intermediate rounds provided programme monitoring data. The target sample sizes for baseline and endline were 2400 individuals per round (480 per strata); the target sample size for monitoring was 1800 per round (360 per strata). The samples also allowed for comparisons across time within strata (calculating a 15% change in main behavioural indicator over time); significance level (alpha) was set at 0.05 and power (beta) at 80%.
